tt:div.tt:p:
ARCHER: Woodhouse, you
you sneaky old fiend...

This is amazing, seriously,
you outdid yourself.

ARCHER: It's okay,
I'll just wait here while you go

make me a whole new birthday
breakfast not covered in
garbage.

WOODHOUSE: It's not garbage sir,
it's --

which by any definition, yes,
is garbage.

WOODHOUSE: Afraid I don't have
the ingredients to recreate this
exact breakfast, sir.

ARCHER: Why do you even
bother...
ARCHER: No time to talk, Popeye.

Were you going to say Happy
Birthday?

ARCHER: I wonder what the guys
in the office have planned for
my birthday.

Wonder if Fudgie the Whale will
be there or Cookie Puss.

Those guys at Carvel know what
they're doing.
So, what're you ladies up to?

CHERYL/CAROL: Cleaning out the
stupid file room.

LANA: Speaking of,
is that Archer?

ARCHER: Yes,
but I have to warn you...

CYRIL: Or doing your share of
work apparently.

MALORY: You'd better start,
because a lot of this junk is
yours.

Because here's nothing special
about today whatsoever, Mother!

MALORY: Oh,
I wouldn't say that...

MALORY: Yes,
it's the quarterly fire drill.

GILLETTE: Ferris Bueller you're
my heeero...

Hang on,
does nobody seriously know what
today is?!

I never remember it taking so
long.

ARCHER: Well maybe that's
because you never remember
anything!

ARCHER: I -- is that -- what --
Mother...?

MALORY: I believe a "thank you"
is in order.

ARCHER: Mother, oh my God, yes,
thank you!

MALORY: And not just - well,
mostly me, of course,
but Dr. Krieger helped too.

KRIEGER: Well,
only if by "helped" you mean...

Oversaw the design
the world's most insanely
kickass spy car.
BRETT: Yeah, I'm like a magnet.

ARCHER: I -- wait,
is it gonna kill everybody?
ARCHER: It does know my name!

MODEL: To the Dodge Challenger
Special Agent Edition,
brought to you by Dodge.

six speed manual transmission,
and a top speed of 185.

Twin thirty-cal machine guns
mounted in the front...

ARCHER: It makes the Mach-5 look
like a vagina!

MODEL: The interior boasts
mil-spec GPS,

satellite communications,
hi-fi stereo,
rich Corinthian leather...

ARCHER: Corinth is famous for
its leather!

LAWYER: The in-dash bar is to be
stocked with non-alcoholic
beverages only.
Never ever ever drink and drive.

MALORY: Now Sterling,
listen to me.

ARCHER: It's like seeing the
face of God...

MALORY: This car cost me a lot
of money,

so you have to take proper care
of it.
MALORY: And if you crash it --

MALORY: Or God forbid,
if you get it stolen --

MALORY: You won't ever get
another one.

ARCHER: Mother I promise,
I'll take the best care of it of
anything ever.

MALORY: Oh, no,
I don't think that's really --
LANA: Ugh, he's got an erection.

ARCHER: Sorry,
it's this Corinthian leather.
ARCHER: Forgot to close the bar.

LANA: Wow,
so how much did Dodge kick in?

MALORY: Not as much as you'd
think.

ARCHER: So, I hope
this doesn't sound weird...

But I kinda wanna have
sex with you.

Not you the car, obviously,
but you the blonde genie-woman
who lives inside you that talks.
So, what do I call you?

I -- wait a minute,
was that just a lame
prerecorded video?

Or are you pouting for some
reason?

But that totally wasn't
my fault...

You shouldn't even be
able to put the car in gear with
the bar open!

Besides the danger of
drunk driving...

It's obviously a huge
design flaw!

Which is why now you're
all sticky!

Once we get you parked I'll
clean you up and wipe you down
with a fine chamois.

And also quit talking to you,
because now I'm pretty sure that
was just a recording.

Whatever,
either way I'm done talking.
ARCHER: Oh, come on, it's full?

Damn it,
guess I'll have to park on the
street.
MALORY: if you get it stolen...
you won't ever get another one.

ARCHER: Uh,
duh duh duh duh duh...

The grappling hook
detaches from my end?
Way to think it through, Dodge.

ARCHER: So,
clean all the broken glass and

the sticky apple juice,
then I need all new glassware,
some real liquor...

There's a grappling hook in the
street, get that,

and then find out where to buy
caltrops.

ARCHER: Oh, did you decide to
start talking to me?

Nothing, Woodhouse,
what do you want?
Like if Ron O'Neal was a car?

ARCHER: I thought,
maybe she had some sort of,
cloak, cloaking devi-hi-hiiice!

WOODHOUSE: No,
then I'd be standing in it...

ARCHER: What'd you do with
Jeannie?

ARCHER: I swear to God I'll
scoop out whatever organs you
have left and aaaaaghhh!

WOODHOUSE: Sorry sir,
you were going all Bilboey.
Can I see that can for a sec?

ARCHER: I just wanted to read
the warning label about in case
of eye contact!

WOODHOUSE: You did not,
you were going to spray me in
the eyes!

ARCHER: Oh my God, okay,
I gotta think...

WOODHOUSE: They look pretty bad,
sir.

ARCHER: Really?
Because they feel great!

Okay,
so obviously Jeannie was stolen.

And this was obviously a ring of
very high-end car thieves.

So now I have to go undercover
in the high-end car-thief...

whatever, underworld,
and steal Jeannie back!

ARCHER: Not nearly as dangerous
as Mother finding out I lost my
birthday present.

MALORY: Where is your new
bicycle?
ARCHER: And you let her do it.

ARCHER: I'm kidding,
you couldn't have stopped her,
she would've snapped your spine.

LANA: I know you're about to ask
me for a favor, and I say,
wait for it...

No matter what it is,
the answer is no.

ARCHER: Somebody stole my
birthday car.

LANA: Okay,
I'm gonna drink some of this,

and then do a huge spit take on
you.

LANA: I told you I was gonna do
it.

ARCHER: Right, sorry,
guess I'm a bad listener.

Malory told you not to let that
stupid car get stolen!

ARCHER: Thank you,
world's loudest voice!

Now shut up,
because -- for reasons that

don't bear going into,
I have to get it back before
Mother finds out!
LANA: Ugh, okay, I'll help you.
wait, what am I helping you do?

ARCHER: Infiltrate whatever
criminal outfit steals the
hottest cars in the city.
PAM: That would be the Yakuza...

PAM: And man,
against those pinkieless

bastards,
you had better come correct.
LANA: And you know this how?

LANA: Hang on hang on,
you race drift cars?

ARCHER: Oh for -- is anybody not
in here?

PAM: I'm not
crappy, I just started!

ARCHER: Shut up,
when's the next race and we're
gonna pose as your pit crew.

PAM: I -- it's tonight,
and I dunno,

if the Yakuza finds out you're
snoopin around about a hot set
of wheels...

ARCHER: Oh don't worry about me,
I'm -

- LANA: Archer -
- ARCHER: Don't
worry about my methods!

The important thing is that
nobody tells -

ARCHER: What're we doing,
I shouldn't be in here, and...

MALORY: Why aren't you out in
your new car?

Woodhouse is detailing it,
because that's the high level of
care...

ARCHER: Wow,
dodged a bullet there, huh?

And you better hope we don't
have to dodge any literally.

ARCHER: Well,
obviously I hope that.

LANA: I am not super-confident
about this...

And I don't even know why I'm
here.

Then shut up and act like you
know what you're doing.

CYRIL: I don't know anything
about cars.

ARCHER: I meant as an agent,
zing,

okay Pam,
who's the big cheesy-san around
here?

PAM: That would be Mr. Moto,
he's --

(loud whisper) Crapjacks,
he's coming over here!

MOTO: So, shiro kabocha ,
you are back.
But I do not know these people!

ARCHER: Sorry hi, I'm Randy,
crew leader,
and --

MOTO: Why does this
underling speak to me?

CYRIL: Right
in the head and ass.

MOTO: Let that be a lesson to
you!

PAM: Aw man,
I just totally lost face!

So uh,
you rethinking that rampage?

LANA: Then can we please get out
of here?

Right after I get my
car.

PAM: No wonder it was runnin
rough...

ARCHER: Now which one of you
pussies has it?!

So, just a heads up,
I'm starting the rampage now.

LANA: I am so angry at you right
now...

MOTO: One question,
before you die...

Hi, listen,
I can't really talk right now,
can I call you back?

ARCHER: Or are you pouting for
some - oh crap,
are you already at 21?

Sorry, I'm running late,
so go ahead and order me four

MALORY: Sterling Malory Archer,
you inconsiderate little --

But seriously,
I bet I will be late,

so go ahead pull the trigger on
those --

What kind of ass would be late
for his own birthday dinner?

CHERYL/CAROL: Mmmm,
the kind who'd infiltrate the
Yakuza?

CHERYL/CAROL: No,
I've said too much alread --
You got another one in ya?

ARCHER: And that, I guess,
is a pretty long answer to why

I'd go on a suicide mission to
get back my birthday car.

CYRIL: Because of a stupid
bicycle?!

ARCHER: What part of "five-speed
Schwinn Stingray" are you not
getting?!

MOTO: Are you -- and I'm being
serious here, are you insane?

ARCHER: Mmmmaybe some mild
post-traumatic stress disorder,
but --

LANA: But he drinks a lot,
so --

ARCHER: So yeah,
I think I've got a pretty good
handle on it.

MOTO: We don't even have your
damn car!

ARCHER: Okay, and why,
would I believe you?

Either way we're going to kill
you!

LANA: And if they don't,
I'm going to.

ARCHER: Wh-?
How is this my fault?
MALORY: This is all my fault!

I should've never gotten him
that car,

it's that damn bicycle all over
again!

And who the hell taught you how
to drive?

CHERYL/CAROL: This guy I know,
named...
Bet you feel like a dick.

ARCHER: No, because look,
if this whole thing is anybody's
fault, it's -- Pam!

Can't see shit,
my car's shot to shit,

and I only had three shitty
payments --
Pam, if you do that again...

PAM: What're ya gonna do,
shoot my car?

ARCHER: Cyril here,
make yourself useful!
CYRIL: I -- no, ya know what?

The way I see it,
we're the bad guys here!

CYRIL: Who were minding their
own business --

CYRIL: But you come in
here, guns blazing,

CYRIL: Shut up,
because now we're gonna die!

PAM: Not if shiro kabocha can
help it...

LANA: Whoa! Pam,
you're actually pretty bad-ass
at this.

PAM: Duh!
Why d'ya think they call me
shiro kabocha ?

CYRIL: Yeah what does that mean,
anyway?
PAM: Yeah, we'll see about that.
PAM: Shut up, gimme the gun.

PAM: No shit I'm agitated,
look at my car!
ARCHER: At least you have one!

And thanks to you we wasted all
night dicking around with the

Yakuza,
and I still don't know who stole
my frickin --

ARCHER: I, uh,
what're you doing here,

did you not hear my outgoing
voicemail?

MALORY: Did you not hear me tell
you not to let your brand-new
car get stolen?

CHERYL/CAROL: She beat it out of
me!

But nooo,
you didn't listen to me.
And then you lied to me.

And then you almost got everyone
killed,
and --

I'll kill you all right
now!

MALORY: That was for Pearl
Harbor!

Oh yes,
and all because you're
irresponsible!

ARCHER: No I'm -- well,
not with the car...

MALORY: Are you -- Sterling,
you left it unlocked in an
unattended garage!

MALORY: Well, not me personally,
I --
MALORY: To teach you a lesson!

Just like with that damn bicycle
when you were eight years old!

ARCHER: Wh-?
You stole my bike?

MALORY: I came home from work,
and it was just lying on the

sidewalk, and I thought "Oh,
this will teach him."

LANA: But so,
did you talk to him about

responsibility when you gave it
back?

MALORY: Well what kind of lesson
would that be?

I'm afraid it already has a new
owner...

MAN: Yeah,
that's what I'm talking about.
What are you lookin' at Sucker.
